inclusion.criterion: Patient to receive 4mg of intravenous ondansetron
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: intravenous ondansetron. Administration of ondansetron will be at the discretion of the attending physician.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: A twelve-lead electrocardiogram (EKG) or 12-lead rhythm strip will be generated prior to drug administration, and every 2 minutes following drug administration for 20 minutes after administration.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: The global objective of this study is to determine if routine use of intravenous ondansetron in the emergency department is associated with cardiac risks.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: received oral or intravenous ondansetron within 4 hours of enrollment
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: co-administration of any known QT prolonging agents
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: QTc on baseline of >450 ms for males and >470ms for females
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: allergy or known hypersensitivity to ondansetron
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: no mention of non-sinus rhythm on baseline EKG

exclusion.criterion: hypokalemia (as defined by the lower limit of normal for the reference laboratory)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: hypomagnesemia (as defined by the lower limit of normal for the reference laboratory)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has history of CAD and prior MI, HLD, HTN, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope. He was recently discharged after a negative work-up for syncope which included the implantation of a cardiac monitoring device.
